resources.string:
Scrambled Net

Connect the terminals to the server by rotating the tiles. Touch a tile to rotate it; press and hold a tile to lock it when you think it's correct. Use the menu to select different skill levels, pause the game, or start a new game.

 See the help in the menu for a full user's guide.

 Tap the screen to start.

Scrambled Net

Connect the terminals to the server by rotating the tiles. Touch a tile to rotate it; press and hold a tile to lock it when you think it's correct. Use the menu to select different skill levels, pause the game, or start a new game.

 See the help in the menu for a full user's guide.

 Tap the screen to start.

At Insane level, the board edges wrap around; cells on the right edge connect to those on the left edge, and vice versa. Similarly for the top and bottom edges. But in addition, in cells with 3 or 4 connections, the wiring is invisible. Good luck!

Scrambled Net, an Android puzzle game by Ian Cameron Smith. Maintained by Michael Mueller. Inspired by KNetwalk by Andi Peredri, Thomas Nagy, and Reinhold Kainhofer. Includes MTRandom by David Beaumont. Chinese translation by HiAPK.com.
\ 
\ For information and source code see the project home page.
